variables.en:
The total demographic dependency ratio is the ratio of the combined youth population (0 to 19 years) and senior population (65 or older) to the working-age population (20 to 64 years). It is expressed as the number of 'dependents' for every 100 'workers'.

Index: The record number of the data row.

CSDUID: Based on Statistics Canada's Standard Geographical Classification (SGC) 2016. Census subdivision (CSD) is the general term for municipalities (as determined by provincial/territorial legislation) or areas treated as municipal equivalents for statistical purposes (e.g., Indian reserves, Indian settlements and unorganized territories).

RuralUrbanFlag: Based on Statistics Canada's Standard Geographical Classification (SGC) 2016. All regions and regional aggregates outside census metropolitan areas/census agglomerations were coded as Rural. All regions within census metropolitan areas/census agglomerations and regional aggregates were coded as Urban.

Provincial Urban/Rural Dependency Ratio: The dependency ratio calculated on a provincial level for all populations in either urban or rural areas, with all regions and regional aggregates outside census metropolitan areas/census agglomerations coded as rural and all regions within census metropolitan areas/census agglomerations and regional aggregates coded as urban.

CSDDependency Ratio: The dependency ratio calculated for each Census Subdivision.
